action.action-desc: Mr. Richmond (for himself, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Conyers, Ms. Kaptur, Mr. Blumenauer, and Mr. Rush) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the United States Postal Service may provide certain basic financial services, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Providing Opportunities for Savings, Transactions, And Lending Act of 2017 or the POSTAL Act of 2017.

section.header: Authority for the Postal Service to offer certain financial services

subsection.text: Section 404(a) of title 39, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (7), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (8), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
to provide basic financial services, including—

subparagraph.text: alone, or in partnership with depository institutions (as defined under section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813)) and credit unions—

clause.text: checking accounts and interest-bearing savings accounts; and
services relating to international money transfers;

subparagraph.text: such other basic financial services as the Postal Service determines appropriate in the public interest; and
the creation of a Postal Card that allows users to engage in the financial services described under this paragraph.

subsection.text: Section 404(e)(2) of title 39, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: The preceding sentence shall not apply to any financial service offered by the Postal Service under subsection (a)(9)..
